page.title: 13BEE-KEEPING. SCALES
page.content: Mr. Whalley lives at Honey Pot Cottage Aldingham. He is a bee-keeper and his apiary is in Scales. He has twelve hives and has kept bees since 1950. He belongs to the National Association of Bee-Keepers and has been to the International Honey Show in London many times.The county branch is called the Cumbria Bee-Keepers association and they hold weekend courses at Newton Rigg. Mr.Whalley attends these get to-gethers.There is also a local branch called the Ulverston Beekeepers Assocatoin where local people meet in their homes on a help each other basis and discuss their problems and have a cup of coffee. People call at his house to buy honey and he sells it at the rose show held at Holker Hall each July. He sold approximately 350lbs of honey last year. He says good tempered keepers have good tempered bees.
